That's a great approach! Sharing a personal anecdote can make your post more relatable and engaging, and it's even more effective when it's a story that comes from your own experience.

It's also excellent that you're participating in the weekly challenge in the "Marketing Professionals Network" group on LinkedIn. That's a great way to stay active, engaged, and motivated, and it can help you build your personal brand and establish yourself as a thought leader in the marketing space.

When crafting your story, remember to:

* Start with a hook to grab the reader's attention
* Set the scene and provide context for your story
* Share the challenge or problem you faced
* Explain how you overcame the challenge or solved the problem
* Highlight the key takeaways or lessons learned
* Tie the story back to the topic of social media in influencer marketing

Also, don't forget to keep your story concise, clear, and easy to follow. You want to make it easy for your readers to understand and relate to your experience.

If you need any more help or guidance, feel free to ask. I'm always here to help. Good luck with your post, and I hope it resonates with your audience!
